intro: Campanula carpatica var. dasycarpa, commonly known as the Wooly Bellflower, is a perennial plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 inches and prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to cultivate. The varietal name 'dasycarpa' refers to its densely hairy fruit capsules.
